pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:0.4.eng: The third training rule on acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññataraṃ kulaṃ ubhatopasannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.2.eng: At that time in Sāvatthī there was a family where both the husband and the wife had confidence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.3.pli: Saddhāya vaḍḍhati, bhogena hāyati, yaṃ tasmiṃ kule uppajjati purebhattaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ sabbaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vissajjetvā appekadā anasitā acchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.3.eng: They were growing in faith, but declining in wealth. Whatever food they had in the morning, they gave to the monks. Sometimes they went without food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.4.eng: People complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṃ jānitvā paṭiggahessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics not have a sense of moderation in receiving offerings?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.6.pli: Ime imesaṃ datvā appekadā anasitā acchantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.6.eng: After giving to them, these people sometimes go without.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.7.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.10.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yaṃ kulaṃ saddhāya vaḍḍhati, bhogena hāyati evarūpassa kulassa ñattidutiyena kammena sekkhasammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.10.eng: “Monks, if a family’s faith is growing, but its wealth is declining, you should designate it as ‘in training’, through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.11.eng: And the designation should be given like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.12.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.13.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.14.pli: Itthannāmaṃ kulaṃ saddhāya vaḍḍhati, bhogena hāyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.14.eng: Such-and-such a family is growing in faith, but declining in wealth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.15.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa kulassa sekkhasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.15.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should designate that family as “in training”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.17.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.18.pli: Itthannāmaṃ kulaṃ saddhāya vaḍḍhati, bhogena hāyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.18.eng: Such-and-such a family is growing in faith, but declining in wealth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.19.eng: The Sangha designates that family as “in training”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa kulassa sekkhasammutiyā dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.20.eng: Any monk who approves of designating that family as “in training” should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.22.eng: The Sangha has designated such-and-such a family as “in training”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.24.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.24.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.25.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni sekkhasammatāni kulāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.25.1.eng: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.26.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.26.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.27.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:1.27.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ ussavo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards there was a celebration in Sāvatthī

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.2.eng: and people invited the monks for a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.3.eng: And so did the family that had been designated as in training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.5.pli: “paṭikkhittaṃ bhagavatā sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjitun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.5.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from such a family, and being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.6.eng: That family complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.7.pli: “kiṃ nu kho nāma amhākaṃ jīvitena yaṃ ayyā amhākaṃ na paṭiggaṇhantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.7.eng: “What is it with us that they don’t receive from us?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.8.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.11.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, nimantitena sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.11.eng: “Monks, if you have been invited, I allow you to eat fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from a family designated as in training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.12.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.12.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.13.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni sekkhasammatāni kulāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu sekkhasammatesu kulesu pubbe animantito khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.13.1.eng: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk, without first being invited, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.14.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.14.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:2.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu tassa kulassa kulūpako hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain monk was associating with that family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.2.eng: One morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, went to them, and sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena so bhikkhu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.3.eng: Just then that monk was sick,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.4.pli: Atha kho te manussā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.4.eng: and so they invited him to eat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.7.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ animantitena sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na paṭiggahesi;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.7.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited an uninvited monk from eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from such a family, and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.8.eng: And being unable to walk for alms,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.10.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.10.eng: He then returned to the monastery and told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.11.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.12.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.13.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.13.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from a family designated as in training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.14.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.15.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni sekkhasammatāni kulāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu sekkhasammatesu kulesu pubbe animantito agilāno khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.15.1.eng: ‘There are families that are designated as “in training”. If a monk, without being sick and without first being invited, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from such a family, he must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.16.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:3.16.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.1.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni sekkhasammatāni kulānīti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.1.eng: There are families that are designated as “in training”:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.2.pli: sekkhasammataṃ nāma kulaṃ yaṃ kulaṃ saddhāya vaḍḍhati, bhogena hāyati. Evarūpassa kulassa ñattidutiyena kammena sekkhasammuti dinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.2.eng: a family designated as in training: a family growing in faith but declining in wealth. Such a family is designated as “in training” through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.6.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.10.pli: ajjatanāya vā svātanāya vā animantito, gharūpacāraṃ okkamante nimanteti, eso animantito nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.10.eng: without being invited for the same or the following day. If the invitation is made when he has entered the vicinity of the house, this is called “without being invited”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.12.pli: ajjatanāya vā svātanāya vā nimantito, gharūpacāraṃ anokkamante nimanteti, eso nimantito nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.12.eng: invited for the same or the following day. If the invitation is made when he has not entered the vicinity of the house, this is called “invited”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.14.eng: who is able to walk for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.16.eng: who is unable to walk for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.18.pli: pañca bhojanāni yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.18.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.20.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.20.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour  products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.21.pli: Animantito agilāno “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.21.eng: If, without being sick and without being invited, he receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.1.22.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.1.pli: Sekkhasammate sekkhasammatasaññī animantito agilāno khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.1.eng: If a family is designated as in training, and he perceives it as such, and he, without being sick or without being invited, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.2.eng: If a family is designated as in training, but he is unsure of it, and he, without being sick or without being invited, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.3.pli: sekkhasammate asekkhasammatasaññī animantito agilāno khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.3.eng: If a family is designated as in training, but he does not perceive it as such, and he, without being sick or without being invited, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from that family, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.4.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.5.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.6.eng: If a family is not designated as in training, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.7.eng: If a family is not designated as in training, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.2.8.eng: If a family is not designated as in training, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.4.pli: nimantitassa vā gilānassa vā sesakaṃ bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.4.eng: if he eats the leftovers from one who has been invited or who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.5.eng: if other people’s almsfood is prepared there;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.6.eng: if they give after coming out from the house;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.7.eng: if it is a regular meal invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.8.eng: if it is a meal for which lots are drawn;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.9.eng: if it is a half-monthly meal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.10.eng: if it is on the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.11.eng: if it is on the day after the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.12.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ— “sati paccaye paribhuñjā”ti deti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.12.eng: if the family gives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics, saying, “Use these when there’s a reason;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd3:4.3.15.eng: The third training rule on acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:0.4.eng: The fourth training rule on acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sākiyadāsakā avaruddhā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.2.eng: the slaves of the Sakyans were rebelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.3.pli: Sākiyāniyo icchanti āraññakesu senāsanesu bhattaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.3.eng: The Sakyan women wished to prepare a meal at the wilderness dwellings,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.4.eng: but the slaves heard about this

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.7.pli: Sākiyāniyo paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ ādāya āraññakaṃ senāsanaṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.7.eng: When the Sakyan women took various kinds of fine foods and set out for a wilderness dwelling,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.8.pli: Sākiyadāsakā nikkhamitvā sākiyāniyo acchindiṃsu ca dūsesuñca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.8.eng: the slaves emerged, and they robbed and raped those Sakyan women.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.9.pli: Sākiyā nikkhamitvā te core sabhaṇḍe gahetvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Sakyan men came out, and they got hold of those criminals together with their loot. They then complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā ārāme core paṭivasante nārocessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.10.eng: “How could they not inform us that there are criminals staying near the monastery?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.11.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū sākiyānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.11.eng: The monks heard the complaints of the Sakyans

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.14.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca saṅghasuṭṭhutāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.14.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.15.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.16.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni senāsanāni sāsaṅkasammatāni sappaṭibhayāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.16.1.eng: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. If a monk, without first making an announcement about those dwellings, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, he must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.17.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.17.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.18.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:1.18.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu āraññakesu senāsanesu gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a monk in a wilderness dwelling was sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.2.pli: Manussā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ādāya āraññakaṃ senāsanaṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.2.eng: People took fresh and cooked food and went to that wilderness dwelling,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.3.pli: Atha kho te manussā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.3.eng: and they invited that monk to eat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.6.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ āraññakesu senāsanesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na paṭiggahesi, nāsakkhi piṇḍāya carituṃ, chinnabhatto ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.6.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited the eating of fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it at a wilderness dwelling, and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept it. And being unable to walk for alms, he missed his meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.7.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.7.eng: He then told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.8.eng: and they in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.10.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā āraññakesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādituṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.10.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk, without first making an announcement, to eat fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it at a wilderness dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.11.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.11.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.12.1.pli: “Yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni senāsanāni sāsaṅkasammatāni sappaṭibhayāni, yo pana bhikkhu tathārūpesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā agilāno khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.12.1.eng: ‘There are wilderness dwellings that are considered risky and dangerous. If a monk who is not sick, without first making an announcement about those dwellings, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, he must acknowledge it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.12.1.comm: It is hard to make out from the Pali what the announcement is about. The crucial word appaṭisaṁviditaṁ can be read as an adjective qualifying khādanīyaṁ and bhojanīyaṁ, in which case it is the food that needs to be announced. Alternatively, it can be regarded as an independent sentence verb, in which case it would seem that it is the risky and dangerous nature of the dwellings that needs to be announced. The word commentary in part supports the former interpretation, whereas the origin story supports the latter. Given this uncertainty, I have opted to translate according to what seems to make the best sense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.13.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.13.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.1.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni āraññakāni senāsanānīti

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.2.eng: a wilderness dwelling: if it is at least 800 meters away from any inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.2.comm: That is, 500 bow-lengths. For a discussion of the dhanu, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.4.pli: ārāme ārāmūpacāre corānaṃ niviṭṭhokāso dissati, bhuttokāso dissati, ṭhitokāso dissati, nisinnokāso dissati, nipannokāso dissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.4.eng: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, criminals have been seen camping, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.6.pli: ārāme ārāmūpacāre corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.6.eng: in the monastery, or in the vicinity of the monastery, criminals have been seen injuring, robbing, or beating people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.10.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.14.eng: if an announcement is made to any of one’s five co-monastics, this is called “without making an announcement”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.14.comm: Sp 2.573: Pañcannaṁ paṭisaṁviditanti pañcasu sahadhammikesu, “Pañcannaṁ paṭisaṁviditaṁ means the five co-monastics.” That is, a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun. The point here is that the announcement needs to be made directly to the lay supporters to be valid.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.15.pli: Ārāmaṃ ārāmūpacāraṃ ṭhapetvā paṭisaṃviditaṃ, etaṃ appaṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.15.eng: If an announcement is made about anything apart from the monastery or its vicinity, this is called “without making an announcement”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17.pli: yo koci itthī vā puriso vā ārāmaṃ ārāmūpacāraṃ āgantvā āroceti— “itthannāmassa, bhante, khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā āharissantī”ti. Sace sāsaṅkaṃ hoti, sāsaṅkanti ācikkhitabbaṃ; sace sappaṭibhayaṃ hoti, sappaṭibhayanti ācikkhitabbaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17.eng: if a woman or a man comes to the monastery or the vicinity of the monastery and says, “Venerable, people will be bringing so-and-so’s fresh or cooked food,” then, if it is risky, this should be declared, and if it is dangerous, that should be declared.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.17.comm: Presumably this refers to a servant or a messenger coming to the monastery to let the monks know of the forthcoming offering of food. The “people” would then be other servants bringing the food on behalf of the donor.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.18.pli: sace— “hotu, bhante, āhariyissatī”ti bhaṇati, corā vattabbā— “manussā idhūpacaranti apasakkathā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.18.eng: If the person says, “Never mind, it will be brought,” then the criminals are to be told, “People are coming here; go away.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.19.pli: Yāguyā paṭisaṃvidite tassā parivāro āhariyyati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.19.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to congee, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.20.pli: Bhattena paṭisaṃvidite tassa parivāro āhariyyati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.20.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to rice, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.21.pli: Khādanīyena paṭisaṃvidite tassa parivāro āhariyyati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.21.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to fresh food, and accompanying food is brought, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.22.pli: Kulena paṭisaṃvidite yo tasmiṃ kule manusso khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā āharati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.22.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular family, then when any person from that family brings fresh or cooked food, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.23.pli: Gāmena paṭisaṃvidite yo tasmiṃ gāme manusso khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā āharati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.23.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular village, then when any person from that village brings fresh or cooked food, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.24.pli: Pūgena paṭisaṃvidite yo tasmiṃ pūge manusso khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā āharati, etaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.24.eng: When an announcement has been made in regard to a particular association, then when any person from that association brings fresh or cooked food, this is called “announced”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.26.pli: pañca bhojanāni yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.26.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.28.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.28.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.30.eng: if the monastery is enclosed, then within the enclosure.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.31.eng: If the monastery is unenclosed, then in the vicinity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.33.eng: who is able to walk for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.35.eng: who is unable to walk for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.36.pli: Appaṭisaṃviditaṃ agilāno “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.36.eng: If, without making an announcement, one who is not sick receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.37.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.38.1.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite appaṭisaṃviditasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā agilāno khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.38.1.eng: If there has been no announcement, and he does not perceive that there has, and he, not being sick, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.39.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite vematiko khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā agilāno khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.39.eng: If there has been no announcement, but he is unsure of it, and he, not being sick, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.40.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite paṭisaṃviditasaññī khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā agilāno khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.40.eng: If there has been no announcement, but he perceives that there has, and he, not being sick, eats fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside that monastery, then he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.41.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.41.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.42.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.43.eng: If there has been an announcement, but he does not perceive that there has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.44.eng: If there has been an announcement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.45.eng: If there has been an announcement, and he perceives that there has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.2.eng: if there has been an announcement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.4.pli: paṭisaṃvidite vā gilānassa vā sesakaṃ bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.4.eng: if he eats the leftovers from where there has been an announcement or from one who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.5.eng: if he receives the food outside the monastery and then eats it inside;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.6.pli: tattha jātakaṃ mūlaṃ vā tacaṃ vā pattaṃ vā pupphaṃ vā phalaṃ vā bhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.6.eng: if he eats a root, bark, a leaf, a flower, or a fruit originating in that monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.7.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ sati paccaye paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.7.eng: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.10.eng: The fourth training rule entailing acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.11.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, āyasmanto, cattāro pāṭidesanīyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.11.eng: “Venerables, the four rules on acknowledgment have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.12.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.18.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.2.19.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment is finished.
